availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Crittendon County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Letitia Wallace. Father of C.H. Wallace, William P. Wallace, Mary H. Wallace, and Thomas Wallace. Farmer in Louisville, Jefferson County in 1860. Farmer in Crittendon County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District No 3 City of Louisville, p. 278A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittendon County, West half of county, p. 372.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kentucky, Crittendon County, West half of county, p. 359.
Find A Grave, "Arthur Hooe Wallace (September 17, 1794-August 09, 1878)," Memorial #64448439, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64448439/ (accessed October 09, 2018).
